Fired from jobs?

Heading: Types of jobs worked
Value: Baseball bat designer, H.S. biology teacher, Football coach

Heading: Employment status during series
Value: Delivering morning newspapers for Dallas Morning News? But didn’t seem to need to work very often due to funds from his parents, left to him when they died and Dixie worked in a gift shop to pay all the household bills.

Heading: Sexual preference
Value: Seemed hetero, not stated, but rarely had sex with the prostitutes, more into sadistic demeaning and beatings.

No killings before these three, 1988 suspicious was

Heading: Killer age at start of series
Method of killing
Value: Shot with 44 magnum with silver tips

Heading: Type of serial killer
Value: Not noted, as he insists innocence, but precision and posing bodies seemed to be of a pre-planned organized thinker.

Heading: How close did killer live?
Value: Lived in same city, drove to outside town to do killings, and brought bodies back in town where they could easily be found.

Heading: Killing occurred in home of victim?
Value: None, possibly property he owned, rented by Speedy, another suspect once, who has dropped off face of earth before trial.

Value: No, in field or his rental property

Heading: Rape?
Value: Unknown, victims were prostitutes, and it was before DNA testing.

Heading: Tortured victims?
Value: No torture, but liked aggressive, rough sex anyway, and seemed to hate prostitutes so much he refused to admit he had been with them, even though that would have set him free.

Heading: Stalked victims?
Value: Trolled for prostitutes regularly so they trusted him

Heading: Bound the victims?
Value: Not during the kill, used surprise and trust

Heading: Sex with the body?
Value: One source claims he removed the eyeballs to have intercourse in the sockets. No other confirmation of this.

Heading: Mutilated body?
Value: Yes, skillfully removed their eyes such that it was not noticed till the coroner opened the lids to observe their eyes and was shocked they were not there.

Heading: Ate part of the body?
Value: No, unless he ate the eyeballs, which were never found

Heading: Left at scene, no attempt to hide
Moved, no attempt to hide
Value: Moved after murder and eye removal, so were easy to find, and posed them lewdly.
